text: Listen to ‘The Daily’The fate of President Trump’s financial records.
‘On Tech With Shira Ovide’Sports in a pandemic don’t all stink.
Listen to ‘The Argument’Opinion columnists discuss whether this is the end for President Trump.

Trump’s Clemency Came After Displays of Loyalty by StonePresident Trump’s extraordinary move was the latest example of his bending America’s legal machinery to his advantage.Roger Stone, Mr. Trump’s longtime friend, suggested a possible quid pro quo for resisting intense pressure from prosecutors to cooperate.

In Commuting Stone’s Sentence, Trump Goes Where Nixon Would NotAttorney General William Barr privately argued against clemency for the president’s friend. Senator Mitt Romney called it act of “unprecedented” corruption.
Here’s a look at controversial pardons and commutations going back to George Washington.
President Trump at Walter Reed Medical Center in Bethesda, Md., on Saturday. Erin Scott for The New York Times

Disney World Opens Its Gates, With Virus Numbers RisingThousands of giddy visitors streamed into the Florida resort on Saturday, as Disney tried to prove it can safely operate at a highly dangerous time.
Coronavirus Fears Stem the Flow at Las Vegas’s Oldest BarNevada shut bars again after the virus surged. While restaurants remain open, customers find it’s not the same.
The Virus and an E.R. Doctor’s SuicideDr. Lorna Breen was unflappable — until she faced a new enemy.

How to Reopen Schools: What Science and Other Countries Teach UsThe pressure to bring American students back to classrooms is intense, but the calculus is tricky with infections still rising in many communities.

In Texas Beach City, Out-of-Towners Drove In an OutbreakA month ago, Corpus Christi had hardly any cases and business was booming. Now it is struggling to contain one of the state’s fastest growing outbreaks.

Democrats Tell Biden to Go After Red States. (He’s Being Cautious.)This election, some Democrats argue, offers the party the possibility of a new path to the presidency, even as others warn against overconfidence.

Leading Homeland Security Under a President Who Uses ‘Hate-Filled’ TalkElaine Duke, former acting secretary of homeland security, was taken aback by President Trump’s suggestion of selling Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria.
A writer for Tucker Carlson resigned after he was revealed as the author of racist and misogynist online posts.
